body:
Please specify the details that were requested when you created this issue.

---

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?



#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)



#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)



####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)



#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)



#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

What is the problem you are having with rclone?
-empty output, while requested files exist on cloud and shown with a rclone version before (v1.50.2) 
What is your rclone version (output from rclone version)
-v1.51
Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
-rclone-v1.51.0-windows-amd64.zip
Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
- Google Drive (Shared folder)
The command you were trying to run (eg rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp)
-(.\rclone\rclone.exe --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf --files-only -R GmdShared:)
A log from the command with the -vv flag (eg output from rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp)

>(.\rclone\rclone.exe -vv --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf --files-only -R GmdShared:)
2020/02/29 18:16:24 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.51.0" starting with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]
2020/02/29 18:16:24 DEBUG : Using config file from "D:\\Progs\\DirIt\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/02/29 18:16:24 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
2020/02/29 18:16:24 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.51.0" finishing with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]

Version before:

>(.\rclone\rclone.exe -vv --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf --files-only -R GmdShared:)
2020/02/29 18:18:26 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.50.2" starting with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]
2020/02/29 18:18:26 DEBUG : Using config file from "D:\\Progs\\DirIt\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part09.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part08.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part07.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part06.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part05.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part04.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part03.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part02.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part01.rar
2020/02/29 18:18:27 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
2020/02/29 18:18:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.50.2" finishing with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]
Can you please also post the config file, with the appropriate details redacted?

[GmdShared]
type = drive
client_id = xxx.apps.googleusercontent.com
client_secret = xxx
scope = drive
use_trash = false
shared_with_me = true
token = {"access_token":"ya29.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx","token_type":"Bearer","refresh_token":"1/xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx","expiry":"2020-02-29T19:15:58.2572183+01:00"}
root_folder_id = xxx

Can you also try with the same config file - it looks like from your tests you are using a different config file for each test?

Can you check that `root_folder_id = xxx` is actually the correct folder? Open it in the web interface and check.

Can you do before and after tests with `-vv --dump bodies` please? Hopefully that will show what is going on.

```
.\rclone\rclone.exe -vv --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf --files-only -R GmdShared: --dump bodies --log-file rclone-v1.50.2.log
```

And same for v1.51.0

Hi,
its always the same .conf

https://pastebin.com/4krv3nHc

Can you try with `--disable ListR` and see if that works?

Can you also try deleting `root_folder_id` from the config?

Looking at your log the single directory in the root is listed fine, but rclone doesn't list it any further which is the problem.

Just added --disable ListR and it worked


d:\Progs\DirIt>.\rclone\rclone.exe -vv --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf **--disable ListR** --files-only -R GmdShared:
2020/03/05 07:41:29 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.51.0" starting with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--disable" "ListR" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]
2020/03/05 07:41:29 DEBUG : Using config file from "d:\\Progs\\DirIt\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/03/05 07:41:29 DEBUG : Reset feature "ListR"
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part01.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part02.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part03.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part04.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part05.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part06.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part07.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part08.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part09.rar
2020/03/05 07:41:30 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
2020/03/05 07:41:30 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.51.0" finishing with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--disable" "ListR" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]

> Just added --disable ListR and it worked

OK that narrows it down a bit... From 1.50 to 1.51 there aren't that many relevant commits.

I wonder if this is the problem 4453fa4ba64f6729e99098269d441a207bc2ae08

can you try this?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-084-g22dc48de-fix-4018-drive-listR-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Seems to be okay now:
d:\Progs\DirIt>**.\rclone\rclone.exe -vv --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf --files-only -R GmdShared:**
2020/03/05 17:36:40 DEBUG : rclone: Version "**v1.51.0-084-g22dc48de-fix-4018-drive-listR-beta**" starting with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]
2020/03/05 17:36:40 DEBUG : Using config file from "d:\\Progs\\DirIt\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/03/05 17:36:40 DEBUG : GmdShared: Loaded invalid token from config file - ignoring
2020/03/05 17:36:40 DEBUG : Keeping previous permissions for config file: -rw-rw-rw-
2020/03/05 17:36:40 DEBUG : GmdShared: Saved new token in config file
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part09.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part08.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part07.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part06.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part05.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part04.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part03.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part02.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part01.rar
2020/03/05 17:36:41 DEBUG : 6 go routines active

> Seems to be okay now:

Great - thanks for testing.

I've made a proper fix - can you try this please?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-088-g69563127-fix-4018-drive-listR-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

D:\Progs\DirIt>.\rclone\rclone.exe -vv --config .\rclone\rclone.conf lsf --files-only -R GmdShared:
2020/03/06 17:07:20 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.51.0-088-g69563127-fix-4018-drive-listR-beta" starting with parameters [".\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "-vv" "--config" ".\\rclone\\rclone.conf" "lsf" "--files-only" "-R" "GmdShared:"]
2020/03/06 17:07:20 DEBUG : Using config file from "D:\\Progs\\DirIt\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/03/06 17:07:20 DEBUG : GmdShared: Loaded invalid token from config file - ignoring
2020/03/06 17:07:20 DEBUG : Keeping previous permissions for config file: -rw-rw-rw-
2020/03/06 17:07:20 DEBUG : GmdShared: Saved new token in config file
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part09.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part08.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part07.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part06.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part05.rar
DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part04.rar

DOR6DD-26-2-2020/123456789DOA6DD2GB.part01.rar
2020/03/06 17:07:21 DEBUG : 6 go routines active

Great - thanks for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52 - I may put it in a v1.51.1 also.

issue.title: [Question] Google Drive change file owner/modified by

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi,

This is just a quick question, I was wondering if there is a command or way to change who last modified a file on Google Drive without making another copy? Similar to how renaming a file changes who it was lost modified by.

For example if I'm using service accounts to copy lots of files I would like them to rather say "modified by Sparon" than "modified by mfc--mm1234xxxxxw8e887xxxx" etc.

This is more of a cosmetic personal OCD thing haha sorry it's a bit of a strange request.

If there's no such way then that's completely fine I'll just do some file renames.

I'd also just like to say thanks for fixing #4018, the duplicate folders was bugging me :)

Thanks!

issue.title: Rclone size reports incorrect size if --fast-list is used ( default behaviour )

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

```rclone size remote:``` reports incorrect size for non team drive remotes if --fast-list is used . If i use ```rclone size remote: --disable ListR``` , i am getting accurate results

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.52.0

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

- os/arch: windows/386
- go version: go1.14.3

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
**Actual size - 2.853 gb**
**Test with rclone size remote:**
```
PS C:\rclone> rclone size test: -vv
2020/05/28 22:57:48 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.0" starting with parameters ["C:\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "size" "test:" "-vv"]
2020/05/28 22:57:48 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Sanjeev\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
Total objects: 63
Total size: 292.184 MBytes (306377599 Bytes)
2020/05/28 22:57:52 DEBUG : 18 go routines active
PS C:\rclone> rclone size test: -vv
2020/05/28 22:58:01 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.0" starting with parameters ["C:\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "size" "test:" "-vv"]
2020/05/28 22:58:01 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Sanjeev\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
Total objects: 74
Total size: 334.623 MBytes (350877842 Bytes)
2020/05/28 22:58:03 DEBUG : 18 go routines active
```
As you can see its incorrect and even reports inconsistent size randomly everytime

**Test with rclone size remote: --disable ListR**
```
PS C:\rclone> rclone size test: --disable ListR -vv
2020/05/28 23:05:18 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.0" starting with parameters ["C:\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "size" "test:" "--disable" "ListR" "-vv"]
2020/05/28 23:05:18 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Sanjeev\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/05/28 23:05:18 DEBUG : Reset feature "ListR"
Total objects: 354
Total size: 2.853 GBytes (3063873067 Bytes)
2020/05/28 23:05:31 DEBUG : 18 go routines active
PS C:\rclone> rclone size test: --disable ListR -vv
2020/05/28 23:05:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.0" starting with parameters ["C:\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "size" "test:" "--disable" "ListR" "-vv"]
2020/05/28 23:05:38 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Sanjeev\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2020/05/28 23:05:38 DEBUG : Reset feature "ListR"
Total objects: 354
Total size: 2.853 GBytes (3063873067 Bytes)
2020/05/28 23:05:40 DEBUG : 18 go routines active
```
As you can see --disabling fast list gives correct results
Although please note that fast list doesnt seem bugged for team drive remotes and personal drives , so anyone who wanna reproduce this , dont test it on a team drive or personal drive remote
 It could be someone else's Gdrive folder which is public or shared with you
For someone who wanna quickly test it , i am dropping my rclone config file , just replace your token
```
[test]
type = drive
scope = drive
root_folder_id = 1vbyJ26ojnw5NvEpL2mrRkl5N--zqc1yZ
token = {"access_token":#####"}
```
( the google folder is public so anyone can test it themselves  its the very same 2.853 gb sized folder used in my test remote  )

**NOTE** - _The issue is not with rclone size but rather with --fast-list flag . Even if i do a rclone copy with --fast-list flag enabled for the above remote , it skips files just like it does while rclone size .I have chosen rclone size to show bugged --fast-list because its quicker than reproducing with rclone copy
